Suggested Fix: Check and replace transmission fluid. Common issue with PowerShift gearbox - may need clutch replacement if severe
PowerShift dual-clutch issue. Update transmission software at dealer. Severe cases need clutch pack replacement

Fault: EML light on with loss of power
Suggested Fix: Common issue with throttle body. Clean throttle body or replace if faulty. Check for error codes first

Fault: Timing chain rattle on cold start
Suggested Fix: Timing chain stretch - needs replacement urgently to prevent engine damage
Turbo failing or boost leak. Check all intercooler hoses for splits. May need turbo replacement
Worn front suspension bushes or drop links. Common wear item on BMWs
DSG mechatronic unit fault. Requires software update or mechatronic replacement
Common issue with window regulators. Replace faulty regulator and check fuse
Weak battery or faulty starter motor. Test battery first - often just needs replacement
Air suspension compressor failure or airbag leak. Diagnose with STAR diagnostics
PCV valve failure or piston ring wear. Check PCV valve first - cheap fix
DPF regeneration needed or EGR valve fault. Try motorway drive first to regenerate DPF
DMF (Dual Mass Flywheel) worn. Needs clutch kit and flywheel replacement
CVT fluid degraded or transmission bearing failure. Change CVT fluid first
12V auxiliary battery weak - not main hybrid battery. Replace 12V battery
Air in brake system or brake fluid needs changing. Bleed brakes and check for leaks
Refrigerant leak or compressor failure. Regas first - may need leak repair
Ignition coil or spark plug failure. Replace spark plugs and faulty coil
Thermostat stuck closed or water pump failure. Check coolant level first
Electric water pump failing - common Mini issue. Replace before complete failure
Transfer case actuator motor failure. Common issue - needs replacement
Air suspension leak - check bags and airlines for damage
Body control module issue or poor earth connection. Check battery terminals and earths first
AdBlue system fault or sensor issue. Top up AdBlue first - may need injector cleaning

Fault: Stop light and SERV light on
Suggested Fix: Multiple possible causes - alternator
Urgency: battery or sensor fault. Needs diagnostic scan

Suggested Fix: Keycard battery flat or reader fault. Replace keycard battery first
DPF blocked - needs regeneration or replacement
Anti-roll bar links worn - very common issue
Battery not charged enough or sensor fault. Check battery health
Coolant level sensor or actual coolant leak. Check expansion tank for cracks
Mechatronic unit or clutch pack fault. Needs specialist diagnostics
DPF regeneration interrupted or sensor fault. Complete a motorway drive
Ignition coil failed - replace all coils and spark plugs
Alternator failing or poor battery connection. Test alternator output
Timing chain tensioner or low oil level. Check oil immediately
Alternator not charging or parasitic drain. Test alternator and check for drains
Boost leak or turbo actuator fault. Check all hoses and intercooler
Clutch worn or contaminated with oil. Check for oil leaks then replace clutch
Wheel speed sensor failure. Clean sensors or replace faulty one
Turbo oil seals failed or boost control issue. Needs turbo replacement
Software glitch - disconnect battery for 30 mins to reset
Electric power steering motor fault or low battery voltage
Throttle body or fuel pump issue. Check for fault codes
Turbo underboost or air filter blocked. Check air filter and boost system
Parking brake actuator motor failure. Common ZF gearbox issue
Worn suspension strut top mounts. Replace mounts and check struts
Glow plugs failed or diesel in fuel filter gelled. Test glow plugs
Head gasket failure or EGR cooler leak. Needs pressure test
Timing chain stretch or heat shield loose. Investigate source urgently
Wastegate arm worn or carbon buildup. May need turbo replacement
Vacuum leak or intake manifold fault. Check for air leaks
ZF gearbox mechatronic or solenoid fault. Needs specialist diagnostics
Sunroof cassette loose or rails need lubrication
DPF blocked beyond regeneration or sensor fault
Steering angle sensor needs calibration or ABS sensor fault
Compressor or air spring failure. Expensive repair
Oil level sensor fault or low oil pressure. Check oil level immediately
Dual-clutch transmission bearing wear or lack of oil
Battery dead or needs reprogramming. Replace battery first
CVT fluid degraded - change fluid and filter

Fault: Clutch heavy and high biting point
Suggested Fix: Clutch worn - needs replacement
12V battery weak affecting hybrid system. Replace auxiliary battery
Auxiliary belt worn or tensioner pulley failing
Fuel sender unit fault - common Honda issue
Common failure - boost hose splits causing loss of power
Electronic parking brake motor or module fault
DEF quality sensor or injector issue. Try different AdBlue brand first
Turbo actuator sticking or vacuum leak. Clean actuator mechanism
Synchro worn or clutch drag. Check clutch pedal free play
Catalytic converter efficiency below threshold or lambda sensor
Cam cover gasket or oil filter housing leak. Common leak points
Door lock actuator failure or central locking pump
Battery not strong enough or system disabled. Check battery health
Exhaust gasket failed or flexi pipe split
Wheel balance or alignment out
Door roller or latch worn. Lubricate mechanism first
Thermostat stuck open or heater matrix blocked
Wiper motor failed or electrical connection corroded
Warped front brake discs. Replace discs and pads
Ignition coil or injector fault. Scan for specific cylinder fault
Software bug - perform hard reset or update software
Carbon buildup on intake valves. Walnut blasting needed
Warped discs or suspension bush worn
Auxiliary battery failing - not main traction battery
Sensor dirty or faulty - clean sensors first
Gearbox seal or cooler line leak. Identify source
Cooling fan not working or thermostat stuck closed
Transmission wind-up causing juddering. Replace VCU unit
Drain tubes blocked - clear drains
Camera dirty or needs calibration
DPF regeneration needed or injector fault
Tailgate latch motor failure or button fault
AdBlue tank low or heater fault. Top up AdBlue
